page.title: 03Agriculture
page.content: The changefrom mixed farming to arable has not been as complete here as in some surrounding areas.Pastoral farming survives at North End (pigs and sheep) and Wick and Bury End (sheep,cattle and poultry)Brookmead farm(cattle).A typical arable farm grows a rotation of rape,3 wheats and barley.Increasing acreages are devoted to oilseed rape which together with Tic- beans (for animal feed) are profitable "break" crops between long runs of cereal-providing the opportunity to apply herbicides that can not be used when land is under cerealproduction.Fertilizer use 1985:150 units of nitrogen were added to wheat;130-140 to winter barley;200 units to rape.Yields:wheat-3 tons per acre;barley-2.5 tons per acre;spring barley 45 cwt per acre.Surplus straw and stubble are burnt after harvest.
